Item.Review:
Pros: Small size, good price, fast internet
Cons: short battery life, no google play,
Very easy to use. Very easy to carry with you. I have my PC and netbook for serious computing, but the tablet is nice when I want to check my email in a coffee shop. Battery life is short, about 2 to 3 hours of continous internet use with video and songs.
Nice tablet for the money without the buyer remorse that happens when you buy other gadgets.

Pros: Overall zippy performance, videos and YouTube looks great, and Skype Video chat works on it!
Cons: The screen quality isn't the greatest
I bought this as a Mother's day gift for my mother to help her get comfortable with email, web surfing, and video chatting. I didn't want to spend a lot since I've built computers for her in the past that pretty much went unused. I'm hoping that a tablet will be more user friendly for her.
Anyways, I'm setting things up right now and I've been impressed with the general zippiness of the tablet. It doesn't come with the Google Play App store (although there are instructions on the web on how to get it installed) but it comes with the GetJar and Amazon App store. It also comes with Skype installed but it didn't work. I had to down ... load an earlier version of the app that was discussed in a web review and that seems to work great!
Browsing the web works great and I easily set up the email client to use my mom's AOL email service. It comes with Angry Birds and that seems to run great.. Video playback is excellent and smooth and viewing YouTube runs great with the included app..
The screen quality is okay. It has the same resolution as my phone and, to be honest, I was a little disappointed when I first turned it on. It doesn't look as impressive as my Nook Color or Playbook but it's perfectly acceptable especially considering the price. However, videos do look really nice on it and the more I use it, the more I'm satisfied with the overall screen quality..
Overall, I've been extremely impressed with this tablet. It's a great starter tablet for someone who is on a budget. expand » « collapse
Item.HelpfulCount: 2 out of 2 found this review helpful.

Item.Review:
Pros: Price, I guess, other than that nothing
Cons: Very short battery life, limited app selection, too often unresponsive
I purchased this tablet as an inexpensive device for my children to play games, etc. We chose the dark blue color but this tablet is an odd light blue. Very limited app selection, can't use Google and had to go through Amazon. Battery life is miniscule, maybe an hour and a half while connected to wifi, a little over two hours if not on the web. Touch screen difficult to use. Tablet freezes constantly. At first we thought it happened only with certain games so those were removed, but now it still happens. The only solution has been to allow the battery to run out, re-charge and re-start the tablet, then try again. It makes a good paper weight, but that's a ... bout the extent of its usefulness. expand » « collapse

This is a very nice tablet for the price that you are paying ($119). Fast boot-up, long battery life, and it comes pre-loaded with basic applications like browser, email app, media player, youtube app etc. It seamlessly connected to my wifi without any problem. Webpage download speed is quite good considering it has only 512MB RAM. Resolution is excellent and you can watch movies in HD quality. Sound quality is excellent through ear phones. Overall a very good tablet

Item.ReviewTitle: I am very happy with this Visual Land 7" tablet
Item.Review:
Pros: Compact size and lightweight .Does everything as advertised.Great display and sound.
Cons: Battery could last longer between charges
I love this tablet and use it every day. Great for getting email fast. Good bright display and sound. Love the Android apps. Have downloaded Kindle and Kobe and enjoy reading e books. I have downloaded several App programs and have even put Google Player on it. But prefer Android Pit and Amazon for downloading apps. Easy to use but It helps to know how an Android system works.

Item.ReviewTitle: Battery only lasts 1.5 hrs while online
Item.Review:
Pros: Looks good
Cons: Terrible battery life and locks up
If you like a good looking paper weight then your all set. Visual Land web site stated battery would last 8 hrs of continual use. It lasts 1.5 hrs with the wireless on and 3 with it off. It will last for days in standby but the only problem is you can't use it. It locked up after about the first 5 minutes of use and multiple times since then. Found multiple problems with not being able to use android market. Tansitions are not smooth. I emailed tech support and have yet to hear from them (5 days). Gave up and took the unit back. Hope this helps having a review from someone that wasn't paid to create it.

Item.ReviewTitle: Awesome Tablet for an Awesome price
Item.Review:
Pros: Price, Capacitive touch screen, Android 4.0, Camera, Usefulness
Cons: No Google Play, Short battery life
The Visual Land Prestige 7 is a tablet that does much more than other $200 dollar tablets can do. It has Android 4.0 Ice Cream Sandwich as its operating system, one of the newest around. It is lightweight and thin, which allows you to carry it around easily, but it also has a short battery life. Also, Google Play doesn't work on this tablet, but the Amazon Appstore does, which provides most of the same popular apps but isn't as useful. Overall, this is a great lightweight tablet that does pretty much what tablet twice the price can do.

Pros: Size, Best Buy's return policy and geek squad help line.
Cons: Unstable operating system, No Google Play andriod app market access
Avoid this tablet! Bought it as a Mothers day gift for mother in law, and had problem with it shutting down intermittently, then Best Buy sent a replacement which, after loading with apps the very first time, would not get past the initializing screen to turn all the way on... I returned both for a refund and spent more money on a 10 inch acer A200 (from best buy) and so far so good...
I do recommend Best Buy because of the service and tech support help the provided when I had problems with the original purchase!!

Pros: Good price, operating system
Cons: screen freezes, flickers and low resolution
Bought this tablet to be shipped to Europe so I could skype with family. Obviously dependability was key which this product lacked severely. It performed well for the price level and I liked the operating system, but the screen would flicker weird colors and freeze atleast once a day that would require it to be restarted. This would not work for elderly people who are technology challenged therefore I exchanged it and bought the Samsung 7 inch $250 tablet. That one worked without a hick up and was just what I needed. Also the screen resolution on the visual land was not as great as the samsung but I guess you get what you pay for. It is a good tablet but still needs to be tested and improved.

Pros: Nice tablet in its price range
Cons: Slow and Battery life
I had an Acer 500 tablet, but I was looking for something more compact as I travel for work. The tablet is pretty good as long as you keep your expectations low. I charged it up and was using it for games and Netflix and it only lasted 2 hours. I lowered the brightness and was able to extend it to 2.5 hours. I needed something that would last longer. Due to only 512MB RAM it was sluggish at times. Couldn't really use Skype because it was so slow. I purchased another tablet that was about $100 more and it fits my needs better. This tablet would be great for my wife just to play with on the couch near a charger, but when you are sitting at the airport or on the plane I needed something that could last closer to 6- ... 8 hours. It really wasn't bad for what you had to pay for it. Just know you are going to have very little battery life. expand » « collapse

Item.ReviewTitle: This product's camera was defective and returned.
Item.Review:
Pros: Was easy to set up and goood p;rice.
Cons: The camera was defective and geek squad no help.
I was so excited to ;purchase this tablet due to my daughter has the one in black in Ky and of course I loved the red. She was able to walk me through the steps to set up tablet. But when I skyped she could not see me with lines across my face. I took it into Best Buy only to have the Geek Squad not try to fix but, sent me to get refund. Since store dfid not carry the tablet in the store ended up purchasing a Polaroid for sale for almost half the cost.

Pros: Great for Angry Birds
Cons: Everything else
I'm not someone who has to be constantly connected, but wanted a mobile device that I could access the internet when needed. I went back and forth between getting a tablet or ipod. I received an email from Best Buy with this tablet on sale, and decided it was a decent price for my needs. The iPad is very expensive, and just isn't something that would be worth the price for me.
The first issue I discovered, is that I had to be within about five feet of my WIFI router in order for it to pick up a signal, and that was weak at best. We did not have any issues with any of our other wireless devices - we can use them anywhere in the house and even out in the yard.
Next issue - the Skype that was preloaded did not work. ... I did reload it, but when we tried to use it, the person I was chatting with saw nothing but red lines.
It's been great for playing Angry Birds, but I don't need a $130 device for that purpose. I've run out of patience to try much else.
All the reviews I saw for this device where positive. I wanted to make sure I posted this so that someone else doesn't make the same mistake that I did.
I'm going to Best Buy tonight and exchange it for an iPod. expand » « collapse

Pros: size
Cons: Everything else
Don't waste your money on this product - it's a $150 'Angry Birds' player. That was the only item that worked correctly and even then it froze up.
The FIRST one arrived defective straight from the box - had it less than a minute before having to call first Visual Land and then Best Buy. Visual Land sounded bored - Best Buy offered to send another right away.
The SECOND one - could not get any of the programs - GetJar, Aldiko, movie streaming - to work. Visual Land doesn't even LIST this product on their website under Technical Support - no detailed instructions.. nothing but 5 basic FAQs (how to charge, how to go online...) If you need anything outside those basic FAQs you have to email/call technical support.
I emailed a ... technician back and forth for weeks (when you call you get a message to try again later) - each time 2-3 days passing in between their responses. After 3 weeks I was finally able to download a book but it required finding 3 other apps, etc. - still no movies, TV shows straight from NBC, no streaming, no music.
Last straw was charging it overnight the other day - I turned it on in the morning and it hovered at the "android" symbol for hours. Could not get it to launch - no response from Visual Land so I'm sending it back to Best Buy - clearly defective the second time around.
I'm heading back to my initial gut instinct - a Kindle Fire. expand » « collapse

Pros: Lots of functionality, Low Price
Cons: No Google Market
I had a gift card and wasn't exactly in the market for a tablet but this came up and i figured i'd give it a shot.
I'm really glad i did because this tablet packs a lot for the price. It's super fast and snappy, is a breeze to set up, especially if you're already familiar with the OS from owning an Android phone.
At first, I was concerned a bit because it didn't have the Google Play Market but my fears were soon alleviated when I found that most of the apps that i wanted could be downloaded through the included marketplace. I quickly had Google Books, Gmail, facebook and Angry Birds loaded.
Also, the included video player can pretty much play anything you throw at it, and that includes .mkv 108 ... 0p blu-ray rip files. It actually plays videos better than my laptop. If you get this tablet, which i highly recommend you do, be sure to get a big SD card to throw a ton of videos on it.
Battery life is ok. I can get about 1-2 movies in before it prompts me to recharge. On standby it lasts about a day or so, the battery seems pretty small because it recharges really fast too.
All in all, i have no complaints and am really glad i bought this tablet. It does everything i ask of it. Pick one up! expand » « collapse

Pros: The price and quality
Cons: Wish it had more memory but not a big problem
Like my title says, the prestige is a really good product for the price. You get a lot of features for a fraction of other devices running android. It has the functions you need and more plus its really easy to use. I would definitely buy this for people who aren't tech savy because navigating through it is easily doable.

Pros: ideal for the price. good to gift to kids.
Cons: just freezes. cannot run with too many applications active
just freezes. cannot run with too many applications active

Pros: Inexpensive, Average construction
Cons: Audio
Everything here was working well, until I ran Pandora (which I got from the Amazon Store). Every single song had the last 5 or so seconds chopped off the end. That was a no-go, since the main reason for the tablet was to use Pandora on my stereo rather than burning out my high end TV.

Item.ReviewTitle: You get what you pay for.
Item.Review:
Pros: Nothing
Cons: Everything.
Out of the box would not connect to the wifi in my house. I have 6 wireless devices connected without a problem so I know it is not my router. Exchanged it and same problem, I ended up returning it. Tech Support no help. Display is horrible, and touch screen not responsive. Ended up getting a kindle fire, no issues.

Pros: Amazon App Store, Size and light weight
Cons: No google play, constant freezing & blackouts.
I brought this device as my first tablet; however, having a moderate level of technical experience, I thought it shouldn't be too hard to navigate and learn. The size is great and for the most part the tablet either had or had access to much of what I brought it for. Still, it had a couple major issues that concerned me enough to warrant a bad buy decision. The support for this device is practically non-existent so any issues you have are basically, “fend for yourself” issues. My biggest concern was the constant blackouts. For no apparent reason this device, though it didn’t start out this way, began to shut down without warning only a few days after the original date of pur ... chase, and it got so bad that I could not get through basic tasks without it shutting off on me and when it did stay on it didn’t take but a few clicks to freeze up. I take this to be a processor issue but, as I said, getting someone to address the issue is not an option when its this early in the purchase so I was just advised to return it and that is exactly what I did. Because of other reviews on this same issue I chose to spring for an overall better tablet… and so far, I love it. expand » « collapse

Cons: no provision for sim card
Can only be use where there is WiFi. Would be more beneficial if sim cards could be used as it is the case in IPADS. Difficult to have internet access in developing countries Nigeria in particular.

Cons: Cannot add any apps
There is no indication before buying this that the Google App store is not available from this tablet from the ads. This severely limits the functionality of this device. The battery life is not long . All in all, I would say to not spend your money on this tablet.

Pros: price, color options
Bought this for my young daughter to be able to play games on -- and not use my phone to do it! It's been great, she has figured out Android, whereas I'm used to the apple os.

Pros: you can return it for store credit
Cons: returned 2 in one week total junk
i got this tablet from best buy online i was happy till i tried to put music on it and the tablet was not seen by my new laptop took it to best buy geek squad they test it and said the tablet usb is dead , i can return it so i did ,had to pay 20 dollars for shipping got the new one 2 days later it was seen by my laptop then as i was putting music on it it shut down and now it will do nothing it just has a long bright line on the screen these are total junk i havent even had one work for over 5 mins. spend the extra money and get a good brand name i learned after i waste 40 dollars for shipping and just got junk

Pros: good price,works as i thought it would
Cons: little bit slower than the galaxy tab
bought this to replace a galaxy tab that is almost 2 yrs old. i figured for this price i can buy a new one every year when a new android OS comes out. i'm very happy with it,works good i got the otg adapters and a keyboard and now i can hook up a mouse and it works with out any problems.also got an mini hdmi cable and hooked it to the TV also works instantly.it is a little slower than the galaxy tab but i can live with that.you should know that you have to download the amazon app store to get more apps. also you can download the "slideme " app store . the screen is very responsive and the display is good, videos plays just as good on the galaxy.as i said i'm pleased with this tablet.

Pros: i have to say not thing is great about it
Cons: its super slow
its pretty hard to use. i wouldn't tell anybody to buy this. i got mine yesterday and the camera didn't work and Skype kept freezing. browser was the same i just stopped using it and im about to return mine today and buy a different one. in better words i got what i paid for cheap thing

Item.ReviewTitle: Well, I can say that it works! But that's it.
Item.Review:
Pros: Fairly Cheap
Cons: Very Slow Rendering/Processor
I bought this device as a kind of extra throw away for those times I need a computer/tablet with me but when the likelihood of it getting broken is unacceptably high. So I leave my iPad in the case and carry this.
It actually works pretty well except that the actual time on a full charge is actually 3 hours continuous and not the 8 hours they advertise. Using WiFi and Lowest Brightness level (there are 3 levels).
Netflix App from Amazon App Store (Google Android Appstore will not work with this device) will install but the quality and poor rendering is so bad that there is no point in using Netflix. It's OK for VERY basic apps only.
Also, after a short time, the device gets hot on the connector side ( ... Right). Don't know how much of the battery time is lost because of heat.
But having said that, I must say that it actually works. It's a single core processor that barely gets things done but it does get them done. So it's a good cheap alternative. expand » « collapse

Pros: Great price, ease of use, quality
Cons: Nothing as of yet
I bought this tablet after I purchased a different brand and was highly disappointed. This tablet is AMAZING! There is nothing that I have found that is less than ideal. The video player is great, it has a camera for taking photos as well as chatting via webcam, and the interface responds smoothly. It's a great device!!!

Item.ReviewTitle: Good on paper but not in reality
Item.Review:
Pros: The tech specs sound great on paper
Cons: This table is hugely disappointing in reality
I purchased this tablet and kept it for a week before returning it. The tech specs looked fantastic on paper, especially for the price. The reality of the tablet was far less impressive though.
The touch screen is very inaccurate and unresponsive. I would have to touch the screen multiple times before the screen would respond, and often, in order to get the screen to respond, I would have to tap about 1/4" to 1/2" above the icon/link/selection on the screen.
Additionally, the screen's display is terrible to the point of being almost unusable. If you can remember watching a television that received its programming through an aerial antenna during bad weather, that is app ... roximately the Prestige's screen resolution.
Finally, the lack of Google Play is a far larger hinderance than I anticipated. Unless you've tried accessing and downloading apps from the Amazon Store before and are happy with those results, then I would strongly suggest that you do not buy this tablet.
In summary, this tablet is not at all user friendly. Although I am a somewhat advanced user, my intended uses for this tablet were primarily to be an eReader, to surf the net, and use a few of the social and gaming apps. I couldnt get any of the apps I wanted, the internet was virtually unsable because of the touchscreen inaccuracies, and the I couldn't even use it as an eReader because the screen resolution was so poor that I got a headache within minutes of beginning to read in just trying to decipher the blurry words of the books. expand » « collapse

Item.ReviewTitle: Good tablet to bring to work
Item.Review:
Pros: Slim Profile, latest android 4.0
Cons: No Google Play access, exterior speaker
I was looking for an inexpensive tablet to bring to the work place and so I purchased this one...Although I usually buy name brand electronics, I thought I would give this Visual Land device a try due to it's low cost....The main purpose for this tablet was so that I could read different e-books as well as watch videos during down time. And secondly, to show still pictures to customers... The tablet connects to the internet flawlessly, the videos stream smoothly and net browsing is fast. The screen is clear and crisp and front facing cam is just as good as any basic PC webcam. There is one small exterior speaker which is good for hearing basic sounds, and sounds quite faint, so I would defini ... tely recommend headphones or an aftermarket speaker system for games, movies, music, etc... Though I was used to android 2.3 gingerbread, the latest Android 4.0 Ice cream sandwich is easy to adapt to and simple to use. It is easy to transfer files to/from any computer via the included USB cable which also allows you to charge the battery via USB. I give the "Prestige 7" 4 stars and not 5 stars only because it's not compatible with Google play... But overall a good entry level, basic tablet for the budget conscious. expand » « collapse

Pros: ICS wifi front facing camera awesome smooth capacitive touch screen
Cons: Missing google play
This tablet has a great battery life for watching movies through Netflix or YouTube has access to all my social apps like twitter and Facebook tumblr and others. I play draw something alot and this is great because it's a large screen compared to having to draw on my small iPhone screen. Love this tablet just wish it had google play. Other then that this is a homerun when it comes to price and features.

Pros: small, good price
Cons: does not have android market
If you are looking for a cheap tablate' this is a great deal. But the screen is really blury and hard to view.. You can not read books or any excell sheets even if you zoom in.

Pros: lots of features in a compact size.
Cons: no google play
I am a beginning tablet user.. still getting used to the touch screen stuff (i'm 43..lol) The features are great and very user friendly. So far I haven't got lost on it and stuck in endless menus.

Item.ReviewTitle: Thought it was too good to be true... I was wrong!
Item.Review:
Pros: ICS, Colors, Good Screen, Pre-loaded Apps, Charges quickly
Cons: No Google Play. :-(
I recently read an article online somewhere about sub-$200 Android tabs. The overall conclusion was that there really weren't any worth picking up besides the Kindle Fire, which is not fully Android in the sense that its OS enviro is adjusted to Amazon's ecosystem.
I've owned a couple of VL's music players that I appreciated-- not being an Apple devotee, either-- because of VL's mix of features/quality and low prices. That's what convinced me to snatch up one of these ASAP, hoping VL would prove to be the misfit of the sub-$200 bunch by making a tab that was a pleasantly surprising mix of features/quality for the price.
I was right!
PROS - Android 4.0 ICS (Can't ... get that ANYWHERE!) - Price (Gotta love it!) - Lots of colors (so that my wife will know which is hers when I buy her the red one!) - A screen that is surprisingly responsive for a budget tablet. - VL addressed a con (No Google Play) already by preloading some apps and placing a bookmark to the Amazon AppStore on the home screen. - Charges quickly.
CONS - That's right... No Google Play.
I'm still adjusting to the differences of ICS (My phone is Gingerbread), so it would be unfair to ding the tablet for these. After only a day, I'm picking it up quickly. My two favorite apps on the Prestige already are YouTube, which looks really fantastic and sounds great, and TweetCaster, which looks so much better than it does on my Android phone.
Another plus-- this little guy is durable. I installed a sketching app on it tonight and gave it to my 4 yr. old-- he drew for about an hour on it and loved how he could erase the screen by shaking the tablet a la the Etch-a-Sketch.
So, I really did think the Prestige would be too good to be true... Looks like I was wrong! expand » « collapse

Item.ReviewTitle: it was no good kept freezing on me and didnt work
Item.Review:
Pros: nothing
Cons: nothing is great didnt work after 2 weeks
it was no good what so ever go it for my daugther as a birthday gift only work for about a week and half after that kept freezing and then it just stop working completey so went and retruned and got my money back

Pros: neat little tablet, easy to use
Cons: it is junk, does not work for more than 5 minutes without crashing
I got this tablet and it was fantastic for 2 weeks, after then it wouldn't work for more than 5 minutes straight without crashing and resetting. I think it had serious hardware issues, sounds like quality problems to me. Anyways, I returned to Bestbuy and got my money back. I'll try a Galaxy next.

Item.ReviewTitle: Great device for an adult or teen
Item.Review:
Pros: It is user-friendly and has everything my daughter wanted in a tablet.
Cons: I wish it had a dual camera....
I purchased this device for my 15 year-old daughter. She absolutely loved the color-choices. She will use it for homework and for play.

Pros: nothing
Cons: every thing
very slow , very hard to operate , battery life under one hour eventhough it takes 4 hours to charge it , many apps don't work especially SKYPE , just a bad tablet , don't buy it !!!

Item.ReviewTitle: Started out fine, crashed and burned
Item.Review:
Pros: Price, easy for beginners, ICE OS
Cons: Quality, speed, dependability
I did my research and found that this little introductory tablet had received fair reviews. I was buying it for my dad's birthday/father's day gift and since he's not especially computer or tablet savvy, I thought it would work out just fine. Wrong! Just over a month of use (just games and web surfing) and it's been crashing a lot. Now it won't even power on completely and freezes. Lesson learned. I got what I paid for. We'll definitely be returning it for a Fire of Samsung 7". Brands I know I can depend on. Thank goodness for premier silver and 60 day returns.

Pros: nothing
Cons: everything
Ordered this item for my daughter, after opening it and playing around with it for maybe a half hour we realized this was one of the cheapest crappiest tablet we have ever seen. Took it back to the store that same day. I was incredibly disappointed with this tablet! You definitely get what you pay for with this CHEAP tablet.

Pros: HDMI,USB Host, MicroSD, ICS 4.0.3, comes rooted.
Cons: Hardware is just not built to last.
I thought I would take a chance on a 150.00 device. It turns out the old saying you get what you pay for still rings true. This tablet lasted about two and a half weeks for me before it had an orange pixel frozen on the screen that would rotate both ways, so it was not truly stuck, but clearly the GPU was not quality. A hard reset fixed that. Then the camera stopped working, a hard reset did not fix that. Also, when brand new, there was a piece of lint or dust underneath the screen with no possibilty to remove it. That was it for me after the camera stopped working. I took it back to the store. I knew its limitations for 150, but was hoping it would work and not break. I knew I wo ... uld need an app killer for 512mb ram, and that the screen is not the best on the market, and the battery life is not the best around, and I was ok with that. Just did not expect it to break in 2 weeks. Seems I am not alone. If this device worked and did not break, it is a nice little affordable tablet. But unfortunately, it seems the hardware is just not quality. expand » « collapse

Item.ReviewTitle: This was a gift for my grandson He loved it
Item.Review:
Pros: playing game and using the internet
Cons: ?
This was a gift for my 11 yr old grandson He loved it. He can take it with him and play games, read or use the internet

Item.ReviewTitle: very happy with it, love playing angry bird on it
Item.Review:
Pros: perfect size,very clear picture,response adequate
Cons: size make it a little hard for me to type,battery has short life,
love the size can put it in my pocket. game of angry bird worked great , also is nothing bad i can say,well maybe-external speaker could sound a little better, also do not compare this to a $500.Apple or Asus this for the price is great.

Pros: Super Responsive Capacitve Screen, Affordable, Great for playing games
Cons: Very basic set-up regarding preloaded apps, Can't find accessories
There are a few steps to get this thing up and running to your expectations. It's very basic as far as what is included on the tablet itself, but the essentials are there to get started. I really wanted Google Play, and since Visual Land doesn't have it preloaded, I found a youtube tutorial on how to download it which helped out a lot. Between Google Play and the Amazon Appstore, I have access to all the apps I need.
Skype didn't work which is actually a problem on Skypes end, apparently they haven't made a Skype app to be compatible with Android 4.0. Visual Land is aware of this problem and you can find a link to workabl ... e version of Skype on their website. I downloaded the older version and it seems to be working.
The most impressive part of this tablet was the screen quality. It actually exceeded my expectations. I didn't expect this type of quality for a tablet under $150. It is very quick and responsive, which is perfect for the games I enjoy playing...Angry birds, Fruit Ninja, Words with Friends.
I also like to cook a lot, and download different ebook recipes. They read fine on the preloaded ebook reader, but I also downloaded the kindle app, which I prefer to use.
Like I said before, this tablet has the basics, it gives you the foundation to customize your tablet to fit your lifestyle. It might take some time, but the good thing is that your tablet doesn't come preloaded with a bunch of stuff you will never use.
Overall I am very satisfied with my purchase. I was hesitant purchasing a brand I wasn't aware of, but I kept my expectations realistic, and wasn't disappointed at all. This tablet is practicle and affordable and fits nicely into my purse too! expand » « collapse

Cons: weird version of Android
VERY VERY disappointed with this. It says Android 4.,0, but will not let you get any apps from Androids app store. Have to go thru another site which is very very limited. Also i ordered it in blue, the picture showing dark blue, but came as a pasty surf blue. NOT impressed at all....

Pros: Inexpensive, slim, Android 4.0
This is a nice looking tablet, it's pencil thin and feels great on the hands. This was one of the first tablets I've seen with Android 4.0, what can I say? For the price there's not much more you can ask for, 7" display which is very responsive, the processor is beefy enough to handle every usage, preloaded apps such as Angry Birds and Skype. Lastly, the five color options is the first I've seen from any manufacturer, great job Visual Land!!!

Hope it was just this one, after the initial day of use, a full night of charging, the operating system would not load. I contacted the help center for Visual Land, asking about this problem, had to wait for response through email. I am taking it back to exchange in hopes I have better luck the second go round. Everyone else seems to have great luck with it. Don't get me wrong, I loved it while it lasted

Item.ReviewTitle: tablet is good for the money BUT........
Item.Review: My son age 13 had this tablet for two days before he dropped it. Thinking it should take a small fall to a carpeted floor well no it won't. Screen was spidered now i have a working tablet with a messed up screen . Does help to buy extra warranty.

This is my first foray into the tablet world and the intent was to buy something for under $200.00 as a birthday present for my 8 year old daughter (I’m 51, semi-tech savvy, but only know Windows). Like anything new I purchase, I spent a few days doing my homework, reading reviews and trying to get a good understanding of what differentiates all the options for the 7 inch tablet I’m going to purchase. I’m not looking for the most expensive or the least, just the best bang for my buck. I think I found it here.
I was all set to buy a Lenevo for $199.00, and then saw this one pop up, one of the only tablets in my price range at the time of purchase that had Ice Cream Sandwich. Add to that, it came with HDMI, USB, 8 Gig expandable (that eliminated a Kindle), and preloaded with some good ... apps I knew would get us started. This had most of the same features as other 7 inch Tablets going 30 – 100% higher.. What did I have to lose?
After 1 week, I couldn’t be more pleased. Between Amazon, 1Market (downloaded after the fact) & Get Jar, I’ve found all the free games and other apps my daughter could ask for to get started. No Android Market? No problem. Pre-Installed YouTube, Angry Birds, ect all work great. The speaker leaves something to be desired, but with all the connectivity options, it’s only a problem if you make it one.
So far, I am very pleased with this purchase. Everything has worked the way I would have anticipated. Easy connection to my home network was a great plus. My daughter is so excited to have an IPAD (No Sweetie, it’s a Tablet PC), that I wouldn’t think twice about doing this for my nieces and nephews.
It’s thin, holds well in anyone’s hand and comes in some nice colors. I’m not enamored in the fact that it’s made in China, but don’t even get me going on that……….
I’ve never written a product review before, but felt obligated due to all the tablet reviews I’ve read, primarily about other products, that led me to this one. expand » « collapse

Item.ReviewTitle: Great for a student on the go!!
Item.Review:
Pros: Compact, fast, affordable
Cons: Doesn't have a carrying case
Being a student it's nice to have a tablet for easy access in class. It allows me to pull up notes, homework, etc... The screen is bright and the touch sensor responds perfectly. Android 4.0 creates a great customizable interface so I can personalize it to fit my needs. You definitely get more than what you pay for when purchasing the prestige

Pros: Easy to set up, excellent price.
Cons: Short battery life when is used WiFi connection all time.
Excellent bought. I definitely recommend to buy one.

Pros: Good games
Easy to use and lots of games to choose from. I first purchased a Cruz tablet hated it took it back and got this one

Pros: price
Cons: quality
Purchased 3 as gifts. 2 out of 3 didnt work out of box.

Pros: nothing
Cons: wont download apps, very slow.
Not a very good product or explanation of what it's capable of. Very disappointed in this tablet
It's great but it only lasted a week and it crack in middle of the screen .
